enWisdom: Trusting in Allah is [a means of] sufficiency

Wisdom: التَّوَكُّلُ كِفَايَةٌ شَرِيفَةٌ لِمَنِ اعْتَمَدَ عَلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Trusting in Allah is an honourable sufficiency for the one who relies upon it

Wisdom: تَوَكَّلْ عَلَى اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ فَإِنَّهُ قَدْ تَكَفَّلَ بِكِفَايَةِ الْمُتَوَكِّلِينَ عَلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Trust in Allah the Glorified, for indeed He has guaranteed the sufficiency of those who put their trust in Him
Everyone who puts his trust in Allah is catered for [and provided for by Him]
Have trust in Allah and you will be catered for [by Him]
Whoever puts his trust [in Allah] is catered for
One who trusts in Allah is catered for
Whoever trusts in Allah, He suffices him

Wisdom: مَنْ تَوَكَّلَ عَلَى اللَّهِ كُفِيَ وَاسْتَغْنَى
enWisdom: Whoever trusts in Allah is catered for and becomes needless [of others]

Wisdom: مَنْ تَوَكَّلَ عَلَى اللَّهِ غَنِيَ عَنْ عِبَادِهِ
enWisdom: One who trusts in Allah has no need for [seeking help from] His servants

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَغْنَى عَنِ النَّاسِ أَغْنَاهُ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: One who is independent from people, Allah, the Glorified, enriches him
How can one whose guarantor is Allah, lose?
